item.title: Sustainable Web Design
item.description:
Sustainable Web Design: A Case Study from the University of Lausanne

Digital products leave a massive carbon footprint. According to the Sustainable Web Manifesto: “If the Internet was a country, it would be the 4th largest polluter in the world.”

We need a sustainable web. While the need for sustainability has been around for a while, it’s now becoming a standard for digital products. Leading web organisations are providing practical and measurable recommendations for sustainable development, such as the Référentiel général d’écoconception de services numériques (RGESN) in France, or more recently, the W3C Web Sustainability Guidelines (WSG).

item.title: Using LLMs to Learn UX
item.description:
How to (Smartly) Use LLMs to Learn UX

Large Language Models (LLMs) have become almost irresistible tools for learning. They’re getting smarter, more specialised, and more helpful, delivering better results and empowering education. Yet, concerns are growing about dependency and the fear that LLMs might replace our own mental effort.

In this article, I’d like to share my thoughts on how to use LLMs to learn about UX, and what to keep in mind when doing so.
